snippet.title: Icahn Ain't No Icon
snippet.description: I've seen Carl Icahn's name in print nearly daily so I'm highly confident I can spell his surname with ease. The “highly confident” phraseology was Drexel Burnham speak, denoting its capacity to raise billions in capital for assorted greenmailers, LBO practitioners and takeover honchos who operated in the mid-seventies and [...]

snippet.title: China Tech Icons Deepen Ties At Internet Security Company
snippet.description: Two of China’s most prominent tech billionaires are deepening their ties at an Internet security company. TCH, a subsidiary of Chinese Internet giant Tecnent Holdings, will pay $52 million for new shares in Kingsoft Internet Security Holdings, a subsidiary of Hong Kong-listed Kingsoft Corp., Kingsoft Corp. said in an announcement on [...] read »

snippet.title: Facebook Allows Teens To Post Publicly
snippet.description: An example post that a teen might want the public to see Facebook announced today that it will lift the restriction on teens posts that set the maximum audience to friends of friends. Starting today, teens can post publicly. The company also said that the first time a teen new to Facebook [...] read »

snippet.title: 20 Tips On Increasing Your Facebook Privacy And Security
snippet.description: Let's face it, we all have an embarrassing photo that we don't want people to see on Facebook. Maintaining privacy on Facebook is important because recruiters, teachers, bosses and college admission committees are highly likely to look at your profile and make judgments about your professionalism based on what they can see. [...] read »

snippet.title: Death of a Science Fiction Icon: The Other Strugatsky Brother
snippet.description: 1978 Pocket Book edition of the celebrated Soviet Science Fiction classic. (Photo credit: John Farrell) This week saw the passing of Boris Strugatsky, co-author along with his brother Arkady of one of science fiction's classic novels, Roadside Picnic. snippet.title: Facebook Adds Twitter-Like Hashtags
snippet.description: Sample Facebook hashtag (photo: Facebook) Facebook announced today that it is allowing users to create and click on hashtags, "similar to other services like Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, or Pinterest." snippet.description: Surely, the fact that Google and Facebook both chose this week to again erode your privacy had to be coincidental.
